title: Setting Up
text: Set up three equations in variable form to represent the situation $$(w=warehouse$$, $$o=office$$, and $$t=truck)$$. We have $$w+o=82000$$, $$o=t+4000$$, and $$w+t=78000$$
speech: Set up three equations in variable form to represent the situation  times parentheses w is equal to, warehouse ,  o, is equal to, office , and  t, is equal to truck  . We have  w plus o is equal to, 82000 ,  o, is equal to, t plus 4000 , and  w, plus t is equal to 78000

title: Simplifying to $$1$$ Variable
speech: Plug in  w is equal to, 78000 minus t  and  o is equal to, t plus 4000  into  w, plus o is equal to 82000

title: Understanding the Equation
text: Notice that the $$t$$ cancels out leaving us with $$82000=82000$$. This means there are infinitely many solutions and that more information is needed to answer the problem.
